study_techniques.name: Pomodoro Technique
study_techniques.description: Time management method using 25-minute focused work sessions followed by short breaks
study_techniques.best_for: Long study sessions, avoiding burnout, maintaining focus
steps: Choose a task to work on
Work with full focus until timer rings
After 4 pomodoros, take a 15-30 minute break

study_techniques.name: Feynman Technique
study_techniques.description: Learn by teaching - explain concepts in simple terms as if teaching a child
study_techniques.best_for: Deep understanding, identifying knowledge gaps, complex topics
steps: Explain it in simple language on paper
Go back to source material and fill gaps

study_techniques.name: Active Recall
study_techniques.description: Test yourself repeatedly instead of passive reading
steps: Close the book and write what you remember

study_techniques.name: Spaced Repetition
study_techniques.description: Review material at increasing intervals to strengthen memory

study_techniques.name: Mind Mapping
study_techniques.description: Visual diagram connecting ideas around a central concept

study_techniques.name: SQ3R Method
study_techniques.description: Survey, Question, Read, Recite, Review - structured reading method
steps: Read - read actively to answer questions
Recite - summarize in your own words

study_techniques.name: Cornell Note-Taking
study_techniques.description: Divide page into sections for notes, cues, and summary
steps: Divide page: narrow left column, wide right column, bottom section
Take notes in right column during lecture
Write keywords/questions in left column after

study_techniques.name: Chunking
study_techniques.description: Break large information into smaller, manageable chunks
study_techniques.best_for: Phone numbers, long texts, complex information
steps: Identify the full content to learn
Learn one chunk at a time

study_techniques.name: Interleaving
study_techniques.description: Mix different topics or problem types in one study session
study_techniques.best_for: Math problems, skill building, avoiding monotony
steps: Switch to topic B for 20 minutes
Switch to topic C for 20 minutes

study_techniques.name: Dual Coding
study_techniques.description: Combine verbal and visual information for better memory
study_techniques.best_for: Visual learners, complex concepts, science topics
steps: Review both text and visuals together

Keep your phone on silent or in another room
Stay hydrated - keep water bottle nearby
Take regular breaks to avoid mental fatigue

Exercise regularly to boost brain function
Eat brain foods: nuts, berries, fish
Study difficult subjects when you're most alert
Use multiple senses while studying
Teach what you learn to someone else
Create a consistent study schedule
Set specific, achievable goals for each session
Review notes within 24 hours of class
Use active learning over passive reading
Take handwritten notes for better retention
Break large tasks into smaller chunks
Reward yourself after completing goals
Join or form study groups for difficult subjects
Use apps to block distracting websites
Practice past papers and sample questions
Summarize each chapter in your own words
Use mnemonics for memorization
Study in short bursts rather than long sessions
Keep all study materials organized
Ask questions when you don't understand

before_exam: Start revision at least 2 weeks before exam
Identify weak topics and prioritize them
Practice with past papers under timed conditions
Prepare all materials the night before
Get a good night's sleep before exam day
Eat a healthy breakfast on exam day
Arrive at exam venue 15-20 minutes early
Stay calm and avoid last-minute cramming
Do light revision, not heavy studying the night before
during_exam: Scan through the entire paper first
Allocate time based on marks per question
Start with questions you know well
Attempt all questions - never leave blanks
Show all working in calculation questions
Write clearly and organize your answers
Stay calm if you feel stuck - move on and return later

mathematics: Memorize all formulas and practice applying them
Show step-by-step working for full marks
Practice mental math for quick calculations
Practice different types of problems daily
english: Read the passage carefully before answering
Use quotes to support your arguments
geography: Study maps and practice map reading
Know statistical data for key topics
computer_science: Trace through code step by step
